Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Level.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelFour, LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Observable
Represents a level in the game, acting as the parent class for specific level implementations.

The LevelParent class provides common functionality for managing the game environment, including the background, user plane, projectiles, and enemies. It also handles the game's timeline and key press events. Derived classes should implement level-specific behaviors such as spawning enemies, checking for game over conditions, and managing the level view.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth)
      Constructs a new LevelParent instance.

      Initializes the game level, including setting up the screen size, user plane, projectiles, and enemies. It also configures the background image based on the provided file path, sets up the game loop timeline, initializes the friendly and enemy units, and creates the mini menu. Additionally, it sets up the key press event handler for user controls and starts the game in a running state.

      If the background image resource is not found, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - The file path to the background image for the level.
      screenHeight - The height of the screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the screen.
      playerInitialHealth - The initial health of the player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the background image resource is not found.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units (e.g., the player or other allies) for the level.

      This method should be implemented by subclasses to add and initialize the friendly units that are part of the level.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks whether the game is over based on the current state.

      This method should be implemented by subclasses to define the logic for determining if the game is over, such as checking if the player has been destroyed or other win/lose conditions.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units for the level.

      This method should be implemented by subclasses to spawn and initialize enemy units that will be active in the level.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates a level view specific to the current level.

      This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide a custom level view that represents the visual components of the level (e.g., health, score, etc.).

      Returns:
      A LevelView instance representing the level's visual components.

    • getScreenHeight

      public double getScreenHeight()
      Gets the height of the primary screen.

      This method retrieves the height of the primary monitor's screen. It can be useful for adjusting the size of elements in the game to fit the screen's dimensions.

      Returns:
      The height of the primary screen in pixels.

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Initializes the scene for the current level by setting up the background, friendly units, and other visual components.

      This method prepares the scene for the current level, initializing necessary game elements such as the background and the display for friendly units (e.g., player health, score). It returns the scene to be displayed.

      Returns:
      The Scene object representing the level's scene, ready to be displayed.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by requesting focus for the background and starting the game loop.

      This method prepares the game to run by giving focus to the background and starting the timeline, which controls the game's main loop. It also sets the game running state to true.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Transitions to the next level by loading the specified level class and setting its scene.

      This method dynamically loads the next level using reflection, stops the current level's game loop, initializes the next level, and sets its scene. It also ensures that the new level is displayed in full-screen mode.

      Parameters:
      levelName - The fully qualified name of the class representing the next level to load.

    • updateScene

      private void updateScene()
      Updates the game scene by spawning enemies, updating actor positions, handling collisions, and performing various game state updates.

      This method is called during each game loop cycle. It handles spawning new enemy units, updating positions of all actors, generating enemy fire, checking for collisions, and updating the game state, such as the kill count and level view. If the game is paused, no updates are made.

    • initializeTimeline

      private void initializeTimeline()
      Initializes the timeline for the game loop.

      This method sets up the game loop by creating a KeyFrame that runs repeatedly at intervals defined by the MILLISECOND_DELAY. The game loop triggers the updateScene() method on each cycle, ensuring the game state is updated regularly.

      The timeline will run indefinitely, creating a continuous loop for updating the game scene, handling user input, enemy actions, and other game mechanics at the specified interval.

    • initializeBackground

      private void initializeBackground()
      Initializes the background image for the game, setting up its size, focus, and key event handlers.

      This method adjusts the background to fit the screen size, ensures the background can receive keyboard focus, and adds event handlers to handle key presses and releases, such as moving the user plane and firing projectiles.

    • fireProjectile

      private void fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user plane if the game is currently running.

      This method checks if the game is running, and if so, it creates a new projectile from the user plane and adds it to the scene. The new projectile is also added to the list of user projectiles for tracking and collision detection.

    • generateEnemyFire

      private void generateEnemyFire()
      Generates enemy projectiles by firing from each enemy unit.

      This method iterates through all the enemy units and attempts to fire a projectile for each. The generated projectiles are passed to the spawnEnemyProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible) method for handling.

    • spawnEnemyProjectile

      private void spawnEnemyProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      Spawns an enemy projectile and adds it to the game.

      If the provided projectile is not null, it is added to the root node of the scene and added to the list of enemy projectiles.

      Parameters:
      projectile - The projectile to spawn.

    • updateActors

      private void updateActors()
      Updates all actors in the game by calling their respective update methods.

      This method updates the position and state of all friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      Removes all destroyed actors from the game.

      This method checks all friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles to determine which ones are destroyed and removes them from the game scene and the respective lists.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Removes destroyed actors from the provided list and the game scene.

      This method filters the provided list to find all destroyed actors, removes them from the root scene, and then removes them from the list.

      Parameters:
      actors - The list of actors to check and remove destroyed ones from.

    • handlePlaneCollisions

      private void handlePlaneCollisions()
      Handles collisions between friendly units and enemy units.

      This method checks for collisions between all friendly units and enemy units. If any two actors intersect, both actors will take damage.

    • handleUserProjectileCollisions

      private void handleUserProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between user projectiles and enemy units.

      This method checks for collisions between all user projectiles and enemy units. If any two actors intersect, both actors will take damage.

    • handleEnemyProjectileCollisions

      private void handleEnemyProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between enemy projectiles and friendly units.

      This method checks for collisions between all enemy projectiles and friendly units. If any two actors intersect, both actors will take damage.

    • handleProjectileCollisions

      private void handleProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between user projectiles and enemy projectiles.

      This method checks for collisions between all user projectiles and enemy projectiles. If any two actors intersect, both actors will take damage.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2)
      Handles collisions between two lists of actors.

      This method checks all pairs of actors between the two provided lists to see if their bounding boxes intersect. If they do, both actors will take damage.

      Parameters:
      actors1 - The first list of actors to check for collisions.
      actors2 - The second list of actors to check for collisions.

    • handleEnemyPenetration

      private void handleEnemyPenetration()
      Checks if an enemy unit has penetrated the user's defenses.

      This method checks if any of the enemy units have crossed a threshold, meaning they have penetrated the user's defenses. If so, the user takes damage, and the enemy unit is destroyed.

    • updateLevelView

      private void updateLevelView()
      Updates the level view to reflect the user's current health.

      This method removes hearts from the level view based on the user's current health, providing visual feedback of the player's remaining health.

    • updateKillCount

      private void updateKillCount()
      Updates the player's kill count based on the number of enemies that have been destroyed.

      This method compares the current number of enemies with the remaining enemies and increments the kill count for each enemy destroyed.

    • enemyHasPenetratedDefenses

      private boolean enemyHasPenetratedDefenses(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Determines if an enemy has penetrated the user's defenses.

      This method checks if the enemy has crossed beyond the screen width, indicating that it has bypassed the user's defenses.

      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy actor to check.
      Returns:
      True if the enemy has penetrated the defenses, false otherwise.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Handles the event when the user wins the game.

      This method stops the game loop, displays the win image on the level view, and sets the game state to not running.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Handles the event when the user loses the game.

      This method stops the game loop, displays the game over image on the level view, and sets the game state to not running.

    • getUser

      protected UserPlane getUser()
      Retrieves the user plane in the game.

      This method returns the current instance of the user plane, allowing access to the player's plane in the game.

      Returns:
      The user plane.

    • getRoot

      protected javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Retrieves the root group of the game scene.

      This method returns the root group that contains all the elements of the game scene, allowing interaction with the scene's components.

      Returns:
      The root group of the scene.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Retrieves the current number of enemies in the game.

      This method returns the number of enemies that are still active in the game, which is based on the size of the enemy units list.

      Returns:
      The current number of enemies.

    • addEnemyUnit

      protected void addEnemyUnit(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Adds an enemy unit to the game.

      This method adds the given enemy unit to both the list of enemy units and the root group of the game scene, allowing the enemy to appear and be updated in the game.

      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy unit to add.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      Retrieves the maximum Y position for the enemy units.

      This method returns the maximum Y position where enemy units can move within the screen boundaries.

      Returns:
      The maximum Y position for enemy units.

    • getScreenWidth

      protected double getScreenWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the game screen.

      This method returns the width of the game screen, useful for positioning elements within the game scene.

      Returns:
      The width of the game screen.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      Determines if the user (player) has been destroyed.

      This method checks if the player's plane is marked as destroyed, indicating that the game is over for the player.

      Returns:
      True if the user is destroyed, false otherwise.

    • updateNumberOfEnemies

      private void updateNumberOfEnemies()
      Updates the current number of active enemies in the game.

      This method updates the variable tracking the number of enemies based on the size of the enemy units list.

    • setMiniMenu

      public void setMiniMenu(MiniMenu minimenu)
      Sets the mini menu for the game.

      This method allows setting a custom mini menu, typically used to pause or resume the game, or navigate to the main menu.

      Parameters:
      minimenu - The mini menu to set.

    • handleKeyPress

      private void handleKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles key press events during the game.

      This method listens for key presses and triggers the appropriate action based on the key pressed.

      Parameters:
      event - The key event to handle.

    • toggleMiniMenu

      private void toggleMiniMenu()
      Toggles the visibility of the mini menu.

      This method either shows or hides the mini menu, depending on its current visibility state. It also pauses or resumes the game based on the mini menu's state.

    • pauseGame

      private void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game and displays the mini menu.

      This method stops the game loop, halts the timeline, and displays the mini menu, effectively pausing the game.

    • resumeGame

      protected void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game from a paused state.

      This method resumes the game loop, restarts the timeline, and hides the mini menu, effectively resuming the game.

    • returnToMainMenu

      protected void returnToMainMenu()
      Stops the current game and returns to the main menu.

      This method halts the game loop, stops the timeline, and transitions to the main menu screen.
